::WindRider::
WindRider walked to the wall and sat down in front of
it. It was true, he had seen a lot of bots who seemed
to be only interested in killing each other. It
saddened him, all the needless death and destruction.
He looked at Battera. "Are the others who think like
you on this planet?", he asked her.
--- logomorph@... wrote:
> ::Battera::
> 
> She looks at him. "Being Maximal or Predacon, it
> doesn't matter.  You 
> have a choice to fight. I choose to work for peace. 
> I know bots on 
> both sides who would rather fight than even think of
> peace. It's all 
> they know and wouldn't know what to do if the
> fighing stopped."
> she looked down. 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, Terry Barlow
> <twb176@y...> wrote:
> > ::WindRider::
> > "No its not", he says chuckling a little. "But
> then
> > again being normal is very overrated." He smiled
> > again.
> > "To tell you the truth, I don't want to fight
> either,
> > but I'm a Maximal, so what choice do I have?"
> 
> 
>
